statement: Jan 27-28 FOMC: pricing proxy skewed to no-change (~88.5% Polymarket snapshot).
market_link: Front-end rates (ZT/ZF) and equity duration (ES/NQ) remain sensitive to data/speaker-driven shifts in near-term policy odds.

statement: Fed calendar: Jan 28 decision 2:00pm ET; press conference 2:30pm ET (Jan 27-28 meeting).
market_link: Known timing concentrates intraday volatility around statement/presser across ES/NQ and the Treasury complex.

statement: NY Fed SRF take-up hit record $74.6B on Dec 31 amid year-end funding needs (Reuters).
market_link: Turn-of-year funding dynamics matter for front-end rates; key is whether conditions normalize post-turn.

statement: Eurozone Dec final mfg PMI 48.8; Germany final 47.0 with export demand cited as a drag (Reuters).
market_link: EU growth softness can weigh risk tone and support UST duration; also relevant for EUR (6E) and USD (DX).

statement: FOMC member Paulson scheduled to speak Jan 3 and Jan 4 (local calendar); details unknown.
market_link: Without topic text, risk is headline/tape sensitivity in ZT/ZN and equity duration (ES/NQ) via reaction-function framing.

statement: Prior US cash close imbalances (Jan 2) were large on the buy side (local feed).
market_link: Closing imbalance effects decay quickly but can contextualize late-day ES/NQ volatility and next-session gap sensitivity.

statement: Macro baseline: latest CPI core y/y ~3.03% (Sep 2025) and PCE core y/y ~2.83% (Sep 2025).
market_link: Inflation baseline informs real-rate sensitivity in ES/NQ and front-end (ZT) when new inflation prints reprice the policy path.
